snippet: At the funeral for a 2-year-old who was shot by her 5-year-old brother in a small Kentucky town, there was anger at those who have judged a lifestyle that includes firearms for children.
abstract: Rural community of Burkesville, Ky, is convulsed by death of 2-year-old Caroline Sparks, who was accidentally shot by her 5-year-old brother Kristian with a gun marketed for children; strong emotions are directed at outside world, which has been quick to pass judgment on parents and lifestyle, but locals see nothing unusual about introducing children to firearms while they are still in kindergarten.
lead_paragraph: At the funeral for a 2-year-old who was shot by her 5-year-old brother in a small Kentucky town, there was anger at those who have judged a lifestyle that includes firearms for children.

headline.seo: Kentucky Town Rejects Girl’s Gun Death as a Symbol
headline.main: Girl’s Death by Gunshot Is Rejected as Symbol
headline.print_headline: Girl’s Death By Gunshot Is Rejected As Symbol
